Aaron Kelly

A slowly fog, the sun it lifts. Off coastal mountainâ€™s soggy cliffs. Ridgeline sitting, saddle straddling. My body - part, participating.

Chilled vapors whisper, ragged roaring. Wraiths a whipping, whirling warring. Mountainous self, countenance clouded. Jagged steep exposure shrouded.

Cold displeased, strength displaced From snow-melt revelation laced, And warmth-awakened emerald face.

As for myself? I wonder too - Since truth is deep, and hardly few. Clinging asking fragile height Who are we - in the sunlight?
